1.text: A name is chosen rather than much wealth, Than silver and than gold—good grace.

2.text: Rich and poor have met together, The Maker of them all is Jehovah.

3.text: The prudent hath seen the evil, and is hidden, And the simple have passed on, and are punished.

4.text: The end of humility is the fear of Jehovah, Riches, and honour, and life.

5.text: Thorns—snares are in the way of the perverse, Whoso is keeping his soul is far from them.

6.text: Give instruction to a youth about his way, Even when he is old he turneth not from it.

7.text: The rich over the poor ruleth, And a servant is the borrower to the lender.

8.text: Whoso is sowing perverseness reapeth sorrow, And the rod of his anger weareth out.

9.text: The good of eye—he is blessed, For he hath given of his bread to the poor.

10.text: Cast out a scorner—and contention goeth out, And strife and shame cease.

11.text: Whoso is loving cleanness of heart, Grace are his lips, a king is his friend.

12.text: The eyes of Jehovah have kept knowledge, And He overthroweth the words of the treacherous.

13.text: The slothful hath said, ‘A lion is without, In the midst of the broad places I am slain.’

14.text: A deep pit is the mouth of strange women, The abhorred of Jehovah falleth there.

15.text: Folly is bound up in the heart of a youth, The rod of chastisement putteth it far from him.

16.text: He is oppressing the poor to multiply to him, He is giving to the rich—only to want.

17.text: Incline thine ear, and hear words of the wise, And thy heart set to my knowledge,

18.text: For they are pleasant when thou dost keep them in thy heart, They are prepared together for thy lips.

19.text: That thy trust may be in Jehovah, I caused thee to know to-day, even thou.

20.text: Have I not written to thee three times With counsels and knowledge?

21.text: To cause thee to know the certainty of sayings of truth, To return sayings of truth to those sending thee.

22.text: Rob not the poor because he is poor, And bruise not the afflicted in the gate.

23.text: For Jehovah pleadeth their cause, And hath spoiled the soul of their spoilers.

24.text: Shew not thyself friendly with an angry man, And with a man of fury go not in,

25.text: Lest thou learn his paths, And have received a snare to thy soul.

26.text: Be not thou among those striking hands, Among sureties for burdens.

27.text: If thou hast nothing to pay, Why doth he take thy bed from under thee?

28.text: Remove not a border of olden times, That thy fathers have made.

29.text: Hast thou seen a man speedy in his business? Before kings he doth station himself, He stations not himself before obscure men!
